name: Behavioral Centers of America
overview: Behavioral Centers of America Corp., a healthcare company, provides psychiatric health care services to adolescent and geriatric patients. The company owns and operates psychiatric hospitals, residential treatment centers, psychiatric specialty units within medical-surgical hospitals, outpatient diagnostic and treatment clinics, and home based programs. It offers facility based services, such as acute inpatient hospital care, medical model and psycho-social model residential treatment, partial hospital care, day treatment, outpatient treatment, physician office visits, diagnostic and assessment services, and psycho-pharmacological treatment. The company also provides home based services, including crisis support, individual and family therapy, care giver training, and social service coordination services; and school based services, such as academic study, preparation for adult living, intervention and assessment services, and GED preparation services. In addition, it offers work based services, such as employee mental health counseling, depression screening, crisis response counseling, and employee training services. The company was founded in 2002 and is based in Nashville, Tennessee. It has facilities and locations in Midland, Killeen, and Belton, Texas; and Columbus, Shaker Heights, and Dennison, Ohio.
